I‚Äôll continue to make the case to military leadership that PNSY priorities must be taken off the list of threatened projects and will continue to explore all means to block this ‚Äúemergency‚Äù declaration from impacting NH.
If Mexico isn‚Äôt paying for the wall, New Hampshire shouldn‚Äôt have to cover the tab.

Candidate Trump made it clear that taxpayers wouldn‚Äôt foot the bill for his wall ‚Äì and when he was in NH, he certainly didn‚Äôt tell voters that taxpayer funds set aside for the Shipyard would be threatened.

As a member of the Armed Services & Appropriations Committees, I fought for these projects & worked to get the funding signed into law. Raiding this funding for his border wall is unconstitutional & disingenuous.
Let‚Äôs be clear: this is no longer a theoretical threat to our Shipyard and our regional economy. The DOD‚Äôs list of potential projects includes more than $224 million in Shipyard priorities.

The President‚Äôs ‚Äúemergency‚Äù declaration jeopardizes NH jobs, the Shipyard‚Äôs mission & our national security ‚Äì all to fund his border wall that he repeatedly promised Mexico would pay for. And now we know 4 projects at PNSY are on the chopping block.
